conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, C, and D, and the task is to predict whether it will flow into container E or F after passing through baffles.
Outlet A is located on the far left, and liquid flows downward toward a left-slanted baffle.
The stream from outlet A reaches the left-hand collecting gutter and ends up in container E.
Outlet B is located slightly to the right of A, and liquid flows downward toward the same left-slanted baffle as A.
The stream from outlet B follows the same path as A and also reaches container E.
Outlet C is located in the center, and liquid flows downward toward a green baffle and then a white baffle.
The stream from outlet C is redirected by the green and white baffles toward the center gutter, which feeds container F.
Outlet D is located on the far right, and liquid flows downward toward a white baffle and then toward the right-hand gutter.
The stream from outlet D is guided by the white baffle to the right-hand gutter and empties into container F.
Final result: A → E, B → E, C → F, D → F.
